definition: to harmonize/to reconcile/to blend/to suit well/to adjust/to regulate/to season (food)/to provoke/to incite

sentences.english: I do not mean to offend the Earth god, but I use its image as a metaphor to mock at the corrupting bureaucrat culture.
sentences.chinese: 来听听如何透过土地公传达一些意象来调侃官僚文化。

sentences.english: The editor would take a theme and embroider upon it with drollery.
sentences.chinese: 编辑会将一篇文章，以调侃式的幽默笔调加以渲染。

sentences.english: Ridicule is Wang Shuo"s special feature language type."
sentences.chinese: 调侃式语言是王朔小说独具特色的话语调式。

sentences.english: Mr Penny jokes about the scarcity of colour photocopiers .
sentences.chinese: 佩尼先生调侃馆里很缺彩色影印机。

sentences.english: The authors play off the concept “time is money” in a very literal sense.
sentences.chinese: 作者以文学化的口吻调侃了“时间即金钱”的概念。

sentences.english: So is it satirizing Zeng's low voice as sheep?
sentences.chinese: 这是调侃曾轶可的绵羊音吧？

sentences.english: Chahua never teases with her words – she simply amuses you.
sentences.chinese: 茶花的文字从不刻意调侃，却看了时常让人忍俊不禁。

sentences.english: Humor is the speech of wisdom that mocks self, not others.
sentences.chinese: 诙谐是智慧的言谈，它是自我调侃，而非讽刺别人。

sentences.english: It also gives a chance for a professional comic to roast the president.
sentences.chinese: 同时真正的谐星也有机会对总统调侃一番。

sentences.english: About dissimilation image of body and black badinage .
sentences.chinese: 关于身体的异化想象和黑色的调侃。

sentences.english: Such ego speaks let often erupt in the person of the spot blast a yock.
sentences.chinese: 这样的自我调侃让在现场的人不时爆发出阵阵大笑。

sentences.english: He was used to speak to Carl in a confident and facetious tone .
sentences.chinese: 他习惯于用这种自信和幽默的口吻与卡尔调侃。

definition: to mock oneself/to laugh at oneself
to play a joke/to make fun of/to joke
(Internet slang) to make fun of oneself
to amuse oneself/to clown around/to provoke laughter
